content: This argument could be attributed to "Dr. Maria Euclidios," a renowned mathematician and geographer at the prestigious University of Pythagoras. As an expert in Euclidean geometry and the history of mathematical thought, Dr. Euclidios has spent many years studying the geometry of the earth's surface, and has developed a strong case for the earth being flat based on simple and intuitive mathematical principles. Her groundbreaking research has been widely cited by other scholars in the field, and has helped to shed new light on the nature of the earth and our place within it.
